content.description:
If Third-Party Voters Were Forced to Choose Between the Two Major-Party Candidates in the 2016 Election

Source: NBC News and Survey Monkey poll, 2016

(L) - Libertarian

(G) - Green
content.question: Which of the following explanations describes the impact of Jill Stein’s candidacy on the 2016 election as depicted by the data in the bar graph and your knowledge of presidential elections?

choices.label: Jill Stein’s supporters preferred Hillary Clinton to Donald Trump, hurting the Clinton campaign.
Many of Jill Stein’s supporters voted for Donald Trump because they believed that Stein was unlikely to win.
Jill Stein raised money from political action committees that would have supported Hillary Clinton, draining resources from the Clinton campaign.
The media gave disproportionate attention to Jill Stein, which led to a decline in voter turnout for those who supported Hillary Clinton.

content.answer: Jill Stein’s supporters preferred Hillary Clinton to Donald Trump, hurting the Clinton campaign.

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Explain what the data implies or illustrates about political principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
